title: Arthur’s Fist
description: A close-up of cartoon Arthur’s clenched fist, used to convey suppressed anger or frustration.

title: Is This a Pigeon?
description: A screencap from a Japanese anime where a character mistakes a butterfly for a pigeon, used to highlight misidentification or confusion.

title: One Does Not Simply
description: Boromir from The Lord of the Rings saying “One does not simply walk into Mordor,” repurposed to exaggerate difficulty of everyday tasks.

title: Condescending Wonka
description: Gene Wilder as Willy Wonka with a sarcastic half-smile, used to mock or patronize a statement.

title: Roll Safe
description: A still of actor Kayode Ewumi tapping his temple, used to suggest flawed “clever” thinking.

title: Hide the Pain Harold
description: A stock photo of an older man smiling painfully, used to convey hidden discomfort or resignation.

title: Distracted Boyfriend
description: A man glancing at another woman while his girlfriend looks on in disgust, symbolizing shifting loyalties or temptations.

title: Expanding Brain
description: Four-panel brain images showing ascending ‘enlightenment,’ used to rank ideas from simple to absurdly complex.

title: Drake Hotline Bling
description: Two-panel Drake rejecting one thing and approving another, signifying preferences.

title: Woman Yelling at a Cat
description: A reality-TV cast member screaming beside a photo of a confused cat, depicting comical arguments.

title: Change My Mind
description: Steven Crowder at a campus table inviting debate, parodied by changing the sign text.

title: Mocking SpongeBob
description: SpongeBob bent over in a chicken-like pose, mocking statements via alternating letter case.

title: Success Kid
description: A toddler clenching sand, symbolizing small personal victories.

title: Bad Luck Brian
description: A school-photo boy paired with captions of comically unfortunate events.

title: Scumbag Steve
description: A teen in a sideways cap symbolizing selfish or unethical behavior.

title: Overly Attached Girlfriend
description: A wide-eyed woman captioned with clingy statements to parody relationship insecurity.

title: Philosoraptor
description: A dinosaur pondering with claw on chin, used for deep or paradoxical questions.

title: Y U No
description: A crudely drawn face screaming “Y U NO…” to express frustration.

title: Doge
description: Shiba Inu dog with multicolored Comic Sans text in broken English expressing inner thoughts.

title: Rickroll
description: A bait-and-switch prank linking to Rick Astley’s “Never Gonna Give You Up” video.

title: Pepe the Frog
description: A cartoon frog used in countless reaction memes, from sad to smug expressions.

title: Left Exit 12 Off Ramp
description: A car veering off highway to exit ramp, illustrating sudden changes in preference.

title: Ancient Aliens
description: Giorgio Tsoukalos attributing everything to aliens, used to mock far-fetched explanations.

title: Brainlet Galaxy Brain
description: A four-panel brain meme with increasingly absurd “brainlet” logic.

title: Skibidi Toilet
description: Surreal meme of a human head emerging from a toilet, set to chaotic music for absurdist effect.

title: Gyatt
description: Slang praising curvy physiques, popular on TikTok.

title: Rizz
description: Short for “charisma,” denoting charm or flirtatious skill.

title: Among Us (‘sus’)
description: From the game Among Us, “sus” denotes suspicion; used to call out shady behavior.

title: Italian Brainrot Animals
description: AI-generated bizarre Italian creatures with humorous backstories, epitomizing modern surreal brainrot.

title: Naked Bass Pro Shops Man
description: A model posing nude in fishing gear, unintentionally spawning countless parodies and mashups.

title: Very Mindful, Very Demure
description: TikTok audio and format contrasting “mindful” behavior with absurd visuals, used ironically.

title: Moo Deng
description: Viral TikTok phrase and dance—“Moo Deng”—used in meme compilations.

title: Distracted Girlfriend (Italian Brainrot)
description: A surreal Italian-styled redraw of the classic Distracted Boyfriend, bridging classic and brainrot.
